data.title: Improve code completion search
data.body:
- List completion by subsequence match.
- Case insensitive search.
- Sort completion list by similarity.

Adds the similarity helper functions to String as well.

Also fix a bug in TextEdit about the cursor position after you undo a remove text operation.

![godot-code-completion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/16021383/b9868ba6-3188-11e6-8a0d-f1cd76552eea.png)

data.title: New Shape2D* icons.
data.body: All sons of old goâ€¦ of Shape2D now have editor icons. I tried to keep the style consistent with the new icons.

data.title: Various optimizations to compiler flags on X11
data.body:
Various optimizations to the compiler flags on X11, ordered from least to most intrusive.
#### Prepend -O options instead of appending

This way, they can be overwritten by passing different CFLAGS/CCFLAGS to scons.
The last option takes effect, therefore we need to prepend them to the
user supplied flags.
#### pass "-pipe" to compiler and linker

GCC will use pipes instead of temporary files with this option,
which decreases compile time noticably.

clang's gcc compability layer also accepts the option, so we don't
have to check for it.
#### Use '-Og' for debugging if available.

Since 4.8 GCC supports the -Og optimization option. According to the
documentation:

> -Og enables optimizations that do not interfere with debugging.
> It should be the optimization level of choice for the standard
> edit-compile-debug cycle, offering a reasonable level of optimization
> while maintaining fast compilation and a good debugging experience.

clang doesn't support it, and people might use a pre 4.8 compiler, so
we check if the flag is supported and only use it if it is.

data.title: Array.sort() should return a reference to the array
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
official 2.0.3stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

This is a detail again but, currently `Array.sort()` returns void.

In certain cases, it could be handy if it was returning the array itself.

For instance it would be possible to write something like this :

```
#displaying dictionary content by alphabetical order :

for key in mydictionary.keys().sort() : #{
     print( key + " = " + mydictionary[key] );
#}
```

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.body: Fixes #5190, param to `.has(var value)` `.has_all(var values)` and `.erase(var value)`incorrectly named value instead of key. Also syncs classref.

data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 bits
Godot 2.1 Alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
While zooming out camera, FPS start dropping. Don't know if I doing something wrong or it's engine related.
Tileset is made of 64x64 tiles (independant png) to avoid artefact with unique big png. If I hide floor tilemap, then i have no FPS drop.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Combine 2D Tilemap and camera, populate tilemap (large), then zoom out

```

main.windows.tools.64.lib(main.windows.tools.64.obj) : error LNK2019: symbole externe non rÃ©solu "char const * * __cdecl tests_get_names(void)" (?tests_get_names@@YAPEAPEBDXZ) rÃ©fÃ©rencÃ© dans la fonction "private: static void __cdecl Main::print_help(char const *)" (?print_help@Main@@CAXPEBD@Z)
```

data.title: Enhanced Android export
data.body:
Improvements on the generation of the final APK:
- Some files on the export template are decided to be kept uncompressed by the Android packaging tool (namely, `resources.asrc`), but more could be there in the future. **Android export now respects AAPT decisions on file compression.**
- The same AAPT tool used in standard Android development keeps certain file types (certain image and media formats) from being compressed because there is little to no benefit, or more, it can be counterproductive. **Android export now avoids compressing badly compressable files.**
- This applies as well to Godot resource files that are already compressed (i.e., scene files). **Android export now checks the header of resource files to check whether they are already compressed.**

Avoiding recompression can improve exporting performance, but more than that, avoids decompression at runtime, which is much nicer.

And finally, the exported APK is aligned to 4-byte like the standard Android packaging process does. It's an important optimization (or could also be though of as a de-pessimization). Basically it makes that at runtime uncompressed files can be memory-mapped to lower the memory footprint and improve performance. So it's sinergystic with the former points.

More details can be found at [the official announcement when they introduced `zipalign`](http://android-developers.blogspot.com.es/2009/09/zipalign-easy-optimization.html). So **now Android export zip-aligns the output APK.**

data.title: Add subsequence search to tools
data.body:
Adds it to the following searches:
- Create node.
- Scene tree.
- Inspector properties.
- Classes list in help.
- Quick open.

Also adds `String.is_subsequence_of(text)` and `String.is_subsequence_ofi(text)` (case-insensitive version).

Closes #5109.

data.title: Calling inner classes with reference
data.body: You can call methods when doing `get_node("*").do_something()` but trying `get_node("*").Class.new()` doesn't work. Ability to reference a class this way would be a pretty cool addition to the language, plus it fits in perfectly and you don't have to write extra methods for just getting them out of the script.

data.title: "Could not determine inheritance" error when inheriting from an inner class
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

X11 (master), X11 (2.0.3-stable), and X11 (2.0-stable) have been tested.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When inheriting from an inner class (according to the documentation at http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/gdscript.html) the following error occurs:

`SCRIPT ERROR: GDScript::reload: Compile Error: Could not determine inheritance`

followed by:

`ERROR: reload: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_COMPILATION_FAILED`

**Minimal example:**

**test1.gd**

```
class Test1:
    func hello():
        print("hello")
```

**test2.gd**

```
extends "test1.gd".Test1
```

**main.gd**

```
extends MainLoop

func _init():
        print("begin")
        var test2 = load("test2.gd")
        print("end")
```

Running the script using the following command: `godot -s main.gd` causes the error. I have also tested this in the editor with the same results.

data.title: Calling .get_mouse_pos() on a render target viewport works, but spams the error log on every call
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX El Capitan, both in the 2.0.3 stable 64bit client and the 2.1.alpha nightly 64bit from 10 jun from fixnum.org

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Calling `get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()` on a node that is within a world inside a `Viewport` works correctly, but logs an error every time.

When ran from the 2.1-alpha client build from fixnum.org (also on local source builds on the tip of master), the error is:

![screen shot 2016-06-11 at 8 30 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10408/15988368/5ea76fc8-3013-11e6-93bf-52542cca207f.png)

When run from the 2.0.3 stable 64bit OSX client, the error is logged, but it is empty (because debug symbols are stripped?)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set up a project with a scene that is within a child `Viewport` that is configured as a Render Target.
2. Have a node within the scene that is collecting input via `get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()` from within `_process()` or whatever
3. Watch the errors pile up

**Coda**

I'm doing the above thing (getting mouse_pos from a viewport that is a rendertarget) because my "game world" has custom lighting and I have GUI elements overlaying the game world. And you _don't_ want those lit the same as the game world, for obvious reasons.

So I'm using a render target. I _also_ have mouse-picking of map tiles in the game world. Before I switched to using a render target, this was straightforward and I could use proper event handling on my player node via `_input()`.

After switching to using a render target, I discovered that `_input()` events aren't being triggered on that node anymore.

So in experimenting I tried seeing if a child viewport would properly track mouse coords (and it does!), but it spews errors because of what looks like an assert in the C++ src.

Any insight on this would be appreciated, especially if it involves suppressing the error or a suitable workaround.

Thanks!

data.title: Editor is broken after setting HiDPI mode
data.body:
Windows 10, Godot 2.1 alpha as of 11/06/2016.

I tried to set the editor in HiDPI, restarted it, then the project selector took a while to open, with these errors looping in the console:

```
ERROR: _png_error_function: PNG file corrupted by ASCII conversion
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:60
libpng error: PNG file corrupted by ASCII conversion
ERROR: ImageLoaderPNG::_load_image: PNG Corrupted
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:94
ERROR: _load_mem_png: Condition ' err ' is true. returned: Image()
   At: drivers\png\image_loader_png.cpp:297
ERROR: RasterizerGLES2::texture_set_data: Condition ' p_image.empty() ' is true.
   At: drivers\gles2\rasterizer_gles2.cpp:962
```

Then if I try to open a project, the same errors continue to appear and the editor eventually crashes with this last error:

```
VBoxContainer: 272,201
bind toptions
..http://godotengine.org/asset-library/api
1 url: http://godotengine.org/asset-library/api/configure
no SSL
2 url: godotengine.org/asset-library/api/configure
request string: /asset-library/api/configure
3 url: godotengine.org
4 url: godotengine.org
Requesting:
        URL: godotengine.org
        String: /asset-library/api/configure
        Port: 80
        SSL: 0
        Validate SSL: 1
ERROR: RasterizerGLES2::texture_get_data: Condition ' texture->data_size==0 ' is true. returned: Image()
   At: drivers\gles2\rasterizer_gles2.cpp:1122
```

Because of this I can't set the option back to LoDPI.
Although my screen is not big enough for this to be enabled, there might be a bug.

data.title: 'Code not correct' on activation email
data.body:
So first of, I apologise for opening an issue on the repo that has nothing to do with the repo - it's just my issue prevents me from using the Godot Answers site.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
N/A

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
So I was just about to get involved on the Godot Answers site and answer a question, so naturally I signed up - using the "Link your GitHub account" option.
When clicking on the link in the activation email for the Godot Answers site, I'm greeted with "Code not correct - please click below to send a new link"
I've tried multiple activations and 2 different emails at different domains but it always ends up the same.

I've tried searching around on the Answers site and here on GitHub for this issue but couldn't find anything. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create new account on GodotEngine.org using "Link GitHub account".
Click on link in activation email.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
N/A

Thanks for the hard work guys - I've only spent a few hours learning Godot but I like what I see so far (mostly)!

I'm more than happy to provide anything you guys may need.
